posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: I need Inventor files for things like Falcons, Limelights, et cetera. Does anyone have them? Not an FRC related project but those materials came to mind for this.

posts.name: Ibrahim
posts.cooked: Havenâ€™t used inventor, but are you not able to just import the given STEP files?

posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: I need to be able to import them into an assembly and mate them to other parts, and Inventor only allows .ipt files to do that (to my knowledge, I would love to be proven wrong)

posts.name: Ibrahim
posts.cooked: On solidworks at least, you can import them then save as .sldprt to use in assemblies.

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: You can definitely import step files into assemblies. When opening a new part to place change the file type to step or all, then open the step file. A window will pop-up but just click ok as the default import settings are what you want typically. After they are imported it will save them as ipts

posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: oh thats great to know! thanks. where is the library for these step files?

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: Thereâ€™s no single library for the step files. Andymark, Rev, ThriftyBot, and Vex all have the CAD linked in the product pages. Iâ€™ve just created my own libraries before the season starts and add to it as we need things.

posts.name: Nick.kremer
posts.cooked:
You should check out KLib, itâ€™s most complete COTS Library for Inventor:

KLib: A Tool for FRC Design Technical Discussion

Discord is the easiest way to communicate over voice, video, and text.  Chat, hang out, and stay close with your friends and communities.

link_counts.title: KLib: A Tool for FRC Design

posts.name: John Keyzer
posts.cooked: When you open a STP or IGES or any other CAD format Inventor will save the file as an IPT, there wonâ€™t be any features shown, extrusions holes etc. but you can modify the solids and use them in assemblies. Our usual process is to open the file, save to a location then place in the assembly.

posts.name: Alexis
posts.cooked: thanks man! i appreciate the help.

posts.name: Peter
posts.cooked:
Iâ€™ve had some success with this before. I know inventor has a conversion extension that you can add for free so long as you have an active license. This lets you convert most 3D files into editable .ipts

Hope this helps!

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
